column4: Does anyone have any ideas on how to troubleshoot a segfaulting firefox?
first question where did you get firefox ?
just from the repos. It came with a fresh jaunty install
disable all plugins/themes etc etc and see what it does
I ran it in "safe-mode" from a terminal and disabled all custom settings / plugins / themes etc. No change in behaviour.
you'll have to log a bug then and post the coredump
How do I get the core dump and where should I post the bug?
launchpad.net - the core dump should probably be in either your home dir or /usr/bin
what would the core dump file be called?
core normally
I did a ls /usr/bin | grep core and didn't get anything relevant
anything in /home/$username ?
Nope, not that I can tell. I ran the same ls | grep core on home and didn't get any output.
is it a segfault, or a core dump
When firefox crashes it prints "Segmentation fault" to the standard output.
Any ideas?
I would open a terminal and launch "firefox" and look for warnings while running
sorry - I mean launch firefox from the terminal
I start firefox from a terminal, and then it just prints Segmentation fault.
you're not overclocking or anything like that are you ?
It's perfectly fine as long as I don't move the mouse.
No, I'm not.
very interesting
